alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 14 at 5:10AM PST until December 14 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * CHANGES...Added Winter Storm Watch for next storm late Wednesday into Thursday. Updated additional snow totals for current warning. * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches east of Highway 395, except up to 4 inches for the Chalfant Valley below 5500 feet. Along and west of Highway 395, additional accumulations of 8 to 18 inches, with up to 2 feet along the Sierra crest. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches near and west of Highway 395, except up to 16 inches possible along the Sierra crest Wednesday evening through Thursday morning. Winds could gust from 80 to 100 mph on Sierra ridges with both storms. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 10 PM PST this evening. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday evening through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...The hazardous conditions will impact this morning`s commute. The next storm will likely affect the Thursday morning commute. Strong winds could damage trees and power lines.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
